alert.note: Alert for Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 19 at 6:39AM EST until February 19 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow showers and squalls expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches. Winds will gust up to 50 mph, which may briefly create localized near blizzard conditions. * WHERE...Garrett County. * WHEN...Until 4 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and result in near blizzard conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of light snow Saturday morning could precede the strong snow squalls near midday. Brief snowfall rates in excess of 1 inch per hour and visibility a quarter mile or less are possible in any snow squalls.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury. If you plan to travel Saturday, have a plan to be able to pull off the road quickly if you encounter a heavy snow shower or squall.
